messages.message: Hey team, what is our policy for EOL / end of support for our release versions? Do we know when 22.01 and 22.05 will no longer be supported anymore, for example?
it seems that we support major releases for 1 year from release date https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/1739194377/Release+Support+Policy#Major%2FStable-release-(external)
So 22.01 should be out of support now.

Technically, but I’m doubtful that all customers are using releases >22.01 right now (@Heymian just confirmed (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C029X8UE16X/p1677261659697679?thread_ts=1677261008.579609&cid=C029X8UE16X) this)
Yeah, and I think there are some on even older releases.
you can take a look at what versions customers are on through the Deployments Sheet (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/150XAa2rnMagfq7gL3_Gw8_XBqmVcY-MC65-Jt6PwNXI/edit?usp=sharing)
We should look at that policy and think about modification to be closer to what our customers can accomplish

I wonder what that might look like… four releases is already lot for EPD to support, but maybe less frequent customer-facing releases would make sense. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

It’s always a hard thing to balance, ime.

Other software organizations often have major and minor releases where major releases can be closer to one year apart.  I have seen support policies be defined as one year after the next major release.  So in this scenario if 22.01 is a major release and 23.01 is the next major release, support for 22.01 would end in February of 24
That said, I would love to get customers on 22.08 at least, so we can get the manual database upgrades out of the way
